Dehydration: Staying hydrated is essential for runners, as dehydration can cause fatigue, cramps, and even heat exhaustion. If runners do not drink enough water before, during, or after the race, they may experience these symptoms.

Nutritional deficiencies: Runners need to consume a balanced diet that includes carbohydrates, protein, and healthy fats to provide their bodies with the energy and nutrients they need to complete the race. If they do not eat enough or consume the wrong types of food, they may experience fatigue, muscle cramps, and other symptoms.

Overtraining: Running too much too soon can lead to overtraining, which can cause injuries and other health problems. If runners do not listen to their bodies and take rest days when needed, they may experience these issues.

Weather conditions: Bad weather such as heavy rain, strong winds, or extreme heat can make running a half marathon much more challenging. If runners are not prepared for these conditions, they may experience fatigue, dehydration, and other problems.

Lack of preparation: Running a half marathon requires a lot of preparation, including training, nutrition, and hydration. If runners do not take the time to prepare properly, they may experience difficulties during the race.
